result.execSummary:
The defendant Justin J Beres was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).
  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant Justin J Beres in court with attorney Jeanne Lila Zamzow.  Defendant Justin J Beres in custody.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Hendee moves to amend the criminal complaint to add Ct. 2, Disorderly Conduct 947.01(1), Class B Misd.    Atty Hendee states plea agreement to Ct. 1 and the added Ct. 2.  
Atty Zamzow agrees.
BY THE COURT:  Court will approve the adding of Ct. 2 Disorderly Conduct 947.01(1), Class B Misd.

Defendant enters a No Contest plea.
  Court questions defendant regarding plea. Advises of Constitutional Rights and elements of the charge.    Court finds plea made freely, voluntarily & Intelligently.  Court relies on the criminal complaint for a factual basis.  
BY THE COURT:  Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.  Court accepts defendant's plea and finds defendant guilty of Counts 1 & 2.

Atty Hendee asks the court to follow the joint recommendation and asks that the defendant report today to the treatment court hearings.
Atty Zamzow makes sentencing arguments.  Atty Zamzow states that the defendant has a warrant out of Adams County and will try to get that taken care of right away.

BY THE COURT:  TREATMENT COURT:
Counts 1 & 2:  Withhold Sentence, 24 months Probation with conditions:
6 months in the Marquette County Jail; stayed for use of the treatment court sanctions
Court Costs = $243.00 x 2
  DNA Sample + $200.00 Surcharge x 2
Participate and graduate from the Treatment Court Program
  Comply with and complete any and all counseling or treatment recommended by the Agent
Credit = to be determined by stipulation by counsel

  If after 24 months the defendant has paid the fine and costs in full, successfully completes Probation, successfully completes the Treatment Court Program and has had no criminal violations, the defendant may petition the court for Expungement 973.015.

**Defendant is to remain in custody until the 1:00pm treatment court hearing; after that the defendant may be released and address the Adams County warrant.  Treatment Court Hearing scheduled for May 3, 2018 at 01:00 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on May 3, 2018 at 09:45 am.
Return date on June 21, 2018 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Justin J Beres appeared by video means. Prosecuting Atty Chad A. Hendee appeared for State of Wisconsin.
BY THE COURT:  Court will quash warrant on defendant's appearance today.  Court questions defendant on his failure to appear.  Defendant thought it was a different date and just missed it.  Says he tried to contact his attorney after that but hasn't been able to get in touch with her.  
Atty Hendee requests cash bond of $1000.00.  Court questions defendant.  Defendant has no objection to the cash bond.
BY THE COURT:  Court sets $1000.00 cash bond.  Return date scheduled for June 21, 2018 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Justin J Beres in court.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Atty Hendee states that bond needs to be set along with booking.
 Court confirms the defendant's address.  Defendant has not received a copy of the criminal complaint yet.  Clerk prints a copy of the complaint and the officer will serve it.  Defendant has now received a copy of the criminal complaint & waives it's reading.  Court advises defendant of right to an attorney.  Defendant understands.  Court finds probable cause to support the charges.

  BY THE COURT:  Court enters a Not Guilty plea on behalf of the defendant.

  Atty Hendee has no objection to a signature bond with conditions.
Defendant asks for contact because of his daughter.  Defendant asks for contact through Ashley Nawrot.

  BY THE COURT:  Court sets a $500 Signature bond with conditions:
*Appear for booking today
*No contact with K.K. except through Ashley Nawrot
